title: The death of Chittibabu, who formed a ‘human shield’ to protect Stalin in jail
content: Chittibabu, who was imprisoned in the Madras Central Prison during Emergency, died of injuries from a brutal lathi assault after shielding a young M.K. Stalin inside a prison cell

title: Tamil Nadu InFocus | Locked up with seven inmates, Stalin was beaten, harassed, and fed kali
content: During Emergency, the then 23-year-old M.K. Stalin spent several months imprisoned in the Madras Central Prison. Later, deposing before the Justice M.M. Ismail Commission, he recounted the brutal treatment meted out to him and the other inmates by the jailers

title: India trails in critical tech, particularly semiconductor tech
content: The U.S. and China lead across five critical tech sectors: semiconductors, AI, biotechnology, space and quantum

title: Tamil Nadu government to give 4% reservation in promotion to its staff with benchmark disabilities
content: However, having regard to the type of work carried out, the government can exempt any of its establishments from the provisions of the reservation in consultation with the State Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities

title: Twins to Chennai’s Munro statue
content: The statue of Thomas Munro in Chennai was one of three equestrian statues of sculptor Francis Chantrey

title: Bombay High Court gives 4 weeks to Maharashtra to fix school safety rules
content: The State Department of School Education and Sports issues a Government Resolution on May 13, introducing new guidelines and safety measures for children in schools after the Badlapur sexual assault case’s court order

title: Migrants from Bengal being detained in BJP ruled states for speaking in Bengali: CM Mamata
content: The Chief Minister said such detentions are being done in BJP ruled states and on some occasion the residents of  West Bengal are being “pushed back” in Bangladesh.

title: Bombay High Court stands with BJP MLA’s election victory, dismisses petition against marital status
content: The High Court dismisses the petition challenging  BJP MLA Rajendra Dhedya Gavit’s election, based on his marital status disclosure and lack of necessary material facts

title: Modi Government left no stone unturned in ruining country’s rapidly growing economy: Congress
content: Congress criticises Modi government for lowest savings account interest rates in 25 years, accusing them of “ruining the economy”

title: Minor killed in Kaliganj bomb blast, 4 arrested in West Bengal
content: In a report to the West Bengal Chief Electoral Officer, the police admitted that crude bombs were hurled from celebratory processions which killed the girl

title: Uttar Pradesh BJP faces heat over allegation that ‘MLA struck official’
content: Banda MLA Prakash Dwivedi admitted scolding the officer for alleged misconduct; This is the second incident in less than a week in which a BJP MLA has been accused of misconduct in the State

title: Dhubri communal tensions: Assam CM says main accused identified; urges surrender
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma assesses law and order situation and declares a beef-free buffer zone around a major Sikh temple in the western Assam town

title: Madras High Court refuses to order defreezing of bank account held by cryptocurrency trader
content: Justice P. Velmurugan dismisses his plea after HDFC Bank says it had received requests from police in Telangana, Karnataka, Kerala, Gujarat and New Delhi

title: With just one govt school for 1.5 lakh population in Bandlaguda, NGO opens free primary school
content: The new school offers classes from nursery to Class 5. With two sections for LKG and one for each grade, the school has enrolled 300 students, all of whom will receive free education and books

title: Two para-athletes from Warangal selected for taekwondo championship in Malaysia
content: The national selection trials took place at Lovely Professional University in Punjab on June 22 and 23, with five athletes from Telangana delivering strong performances

title: 50 years after Emergency: Encounter killings and a saga of silence
content: United A.P. witnessed a quieter yet brutal crackdown marked by encounter killings, arrests of student leaders and Naxalites, and a climate of fear that unfolded far from forced sterilisations, demolitions seen elsewhere

title: Emergency was bid to end multi-party democracy, says Amit Shah
content: It is not only courts and Parliament that are responsible for protecting the spirit of the Constitution, the Home Minister said, emphasising that the responsibility lies with the people too

title: PM Modi invites Mauritian counterpart Ramgoolam to visit India
content: In a telephonic conversation, PM Modi and Mauritius PM Ramgoolam discussed the ongoing cooperation across a broad range of areas, including development, defence, and people-to-people relations

title: Devanahalli farmers reject govt’s proposal on land acquisition and set to embark on a broad-based struggle from today
content: While Large and Medium Industries Minister M.B. Patil offered to drop acquisition in three villages, the farmers groups insisted that acquisition of fertile lands in all the villages in the project area by KIADB should be dropped

title: Two lakh people affected by Ghatal floods, thousands evacuated: West Bengal Minister
content: A war of words has ensued between the Trinamool Congress and Bharatiya Janata Party over the Ghatal flood management project

title: Bihar cabinet approves ₹4,026 crore marriage hall scheme in all gram panchayats
content: Mukhya Mantri Kanya Vivah Mandap Yojana to be implemented over five years; host of welfare and development measures also cleared

title: Centre to challenge Jammu and Kashmir High Court order on repatriation of deported woman
content: The 63-year-old housewife was deported to Pakistan following the crackdown against Pakistani nationals post-Pahalgam terror attack

title: Uttarakhand BJP issues notice to ex-MLA amid allegations of marrying actor without divorcing wife
content: Rathore’s alleged ‘second marriage’ came at a time when the State adopted Uniform Civil Code earlier this year which has strict rules for matrimonial relationships

title: Had invited Rahul Gandhi for talks on voter roll issue, says Election Commission
content: Congress leader shares report that CM’s seat saw 8% surge in voters before Assembly poll; ECI wrote to him on June 12, suggesting a meeting; CM says many Opposition-won seats also saw voter surge

title: India to ‘gradually’ wind up evacuation from Israel and Iran
content: Indian Embassy shuts help desk in Iran’s Mashhad following ceasefire; process of closing evacuations will remain for two days to assess ceasefire

title: Israel-Iran conflict: No alternative to dialogue, diplomacy, says India
content: ‘We wish to reiterate that there is no alternative to dialogue and diplomacy in order to address and resolve the multiple conflicts in the region,’ the MEA said

title: Bike taxi riders decry double standards in Karnataka’s transport policy
content: The riders questioned why two-wheeler delivery agents are allowed to operate freely with white number plates while bike taxi riders using the same vehicles are penalised for passenger transport.

title: CGHS Directorate pulled up by Public Accounts Committee for not revising drug procurement policy
content: Members raised concerns over the supply of outdated drugs to beneficiaries; delays in the settlement of claims; and the absence of coverage for the latest medical procedures under the scheme

title: A.P. Cabinet approves land allotment for Cognizant Tech Park in Vizag
content: 22 acres of land at Madhurawada to be leased to the company at a nominal rate of ₹0.99 per acre,  the IT major is expected to invest ₹1,582 crore and create over 8,000 direct jobs

title: Supreme Court stays deportation of woman from Assam, directs government to not take any coercive steps
content: Jaynab Bibi has claimed that generations of her family have lived in Assam and have documents to prove their Indian nationality

title: Businessline conclave to focus on MSMEs’ role in ‘Make in India’ mission
content: The fourth edition, to be held in two cities, Bengaluru (June 25) and Coimbatore (June 27), will discuss MSME’s  contribution to the Indian growth story

title: Five die after suspected gas leak in well at Madhya Pradesh village
content: Victims had entered 70 feet deep well in Guna district to rescue a cow; toxic exposure suspected, probe under way

title: Party high command asks Siddaramaiah to rein in erring legislators
content: Chief Minister meets President Draupadi Murmu to discuss the Bills awaiting the President’s assent and requests her to clear them

title: Rajya Sabha verifying signatures for Allahabad High Court judge Shekhar Yadav’s removal notice
content: Rajya Sabha Secretariat confirms 44 signatures; Kapil Sibal, nine others yet to verify amid procedural delays

title: Railways considers a marginal hike in fares from July 1
content: Mail, Express fares likely to be hiked by one paisa per km; A/C coach fares to be raised two paise per km; suburban and monthly season ticket rates will remain unchanged; there will be no increase for ordinary second-class tickets up to 500 km

title: Safran to expand operations with MRO facility for Rafale
content: The initiative is expected to create around 150 jobs by 2026 with potential to add another 750 positions in subsequent phases

title: Naidu seeks to allay Telangana’s concerns over Polavaram-Banakacharla Project
content: CM tells Ministers and alliance leaders to explain to the public that the project utilises only surplus floodwaters left after Telangana’s use and does not pose any threat to the neighbouring State’s interests

title: CM accuses the media of villainising organised labour while lionising exploitative corporate employers
content: CM says the Sangh Parivar fear the idea of a pro-worker, progressive, secular and democratic Kerala and worked overtime with the Central government’s help to retard the State’s development and undermine its robust social security net. He accused the Sangh Parivar of stoking communalism to divert public attention from working-class woes and pressing livelihood issues.

title: Devise ways to increase revenue of gram panchayats for a more effective Panchayati Raj system: Amit Shah
content: In a meeting attended by the CMs of four BJP-ruled States, the Union Home Minister said all States should ensure the eradication of child malnutrition, bring the school dropout ratio down to zero, and strengthen the cooperative sector

title: Endosulfan stored for 25 years in Kasaragod shifted to new barrels for neutralisation
content: Central Pollution Control Board completes repacking of the toxic chemical, stored in four barrels at Periye estate, into eight high density polythene containers

title: EAGLE and police officers urge students to stay away from drugs
content: EAGLE is planning awareness drives across the State to prevent drug smuggling and consumption, says official

title: Celtics to trade Porzingis to Hawks, sources say
content: Boston, Atlanta and Brooklyn are finalizing a trade that will send Kristaps Porzingis to the Hawks, Terance Mann to the Nets and Georges Niang to the Celtics, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Kyrie to sign new 3-year deal with Mavs
content: Mavericks All-Star guard Kyrie Irving is declining his $43 million player option and intends to sign a three-year, $119 million contract with the franchise, sources told ESPN.

title: NBA owners approve $1.5B sale of Wolves, Lynx
content: The $1.5 billion sale of the Minnesota Timberwolves from Glen Taylor to an investment group led by e-commerce entrepreneur Marc Lore and former baseball star Alex Rodriguez gained NBA approval Tuesday.

title: Sources: Pelicans acquire Poole in 4-player deal
content: The Pelicans are trading CJ McCollum, Kelly Olynyk and a future second-round pick to the Wizards for Jordan Poole, Saddiq Bey and the No. 40 pick in this year's NBA draft, sources tell ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Arbiter says NFL urged clubs to limit guarantees
content: An arbiter ruled in January that there was no collusion by NFL clubs in response to a grievance filed by the NFL Players Association in 2022 that alleged the league and its member clubs colluded to restrict or limit fully guaranteed player contracts.

title: Bailey focused on hoops amid curious draft path
content: NBA draft prospect Ace Bailey deflected questions about his decision to cancel a workout with the 76ers, who have the third overall pick in Wednesday's first round.

title: Sources: NCAA nears decision on larger tourney
content: A decision on whether or not to expand the NCAA men's and women's basketball tournaments will be made in the upcoming weeks, sources told ESPN.

title: Auckland schoolteacher's 'dream' goal stuns Boca
content: Christian Gray, a physical education teacher from New Zealand, scored to give amateur Auckland City a shock draw against Argentine powerhouse Boca Juniors.

title: 📈 Ranking top 50 MLB trade deadline candidates
content: More Red Sox stars on the move? A former Cy Young available? Here are the big names your team could be targeting.

title: Two-round NBA mock draft: We made 22 pick updates based on intel, trades
content: As trades happen, talks continue with 24 hours until Round 1 of the NBA draft begins. Here's our updated mock.

title: The 'abrupt reversal of fortune' that changed everything for Cooper Flagg and the Mavs
content: The presumptive No. 1 pick and the Mavs, still reeling from trading Luka Doncic, might be made for each other.

title: Power Rankings: Mercury overtake Liberty with five-game winning streak
content: Phoenix has bucked speculation over its new-look roster with 11 wins, including over the defending champions.

title: Why Aaron Rodgers' one-and-done plan is great news for the Steelers
content: The Steelers can start planning for the future of the QB position because they don't have to guess about Rodgers' intentions.

title: Bilas: Eight prospects who stand out in this year's NBA draft class
content: From the no-brainer to the wild cards to those in between, here are eight prospects who caught Jay Bilas' eye.

title: Our one-stop shop for the draft: Mocks, order, big questions and more
content: From teams to watch to our latest mock draft, we have everything you need to know about the 2025 draft.

title: Buzz: How Blackhawks, Isles, Predators could shake up first round
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: What the Club World Cup can tell us about comparing MLS to the Premier League and more
content: How does MLS compare to the Premier League, the Bundesliga and beyond? The Club World Cup might be the best chance to find an answer.

title: Embrace the chaos of Concacaf: 'It's a different football'
content: Every region has its quirks, but few confederations can boast the uniquely charming chaos that is Concacaf.

title: French giants Lyon relegated over financial issues
content: Seven-time French champions Lyon, owned by American businessman John Textor, have been relegated to the second tier of French football due to the club's financial problems.

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Defending champion Florida returns to the top line
content: Florida benefited from the transfer portal -- and some key NBA draft withdrawals -- to get to the top line.

title: As U.S. battle without stars at Gold Cup, which fringe players are stepping up?
content: The U.S. has been without several stars at this summer's Gold Cup, so which fringe players have stepped up to fight for a place at next year's World Cup?

title: Concacaf clears Canada coach Marsch after probe
content: Concacaf has cleared Canada coach Jesse Marsch of any wrongdoing following an investigation into an alleged use of abusive language toward Gold Cup officials.

title: Miami's unbeaten run sets up CWC clash with PSG
content: Palmeiras came from behind to draw 2-2 with host Inter Miami at Hard Rock Stadium on Monday night, with both clubs advancing to the Club World Cup round of 16 and setting up a matchup between Miami and Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Wrexham legend Paul Mullin leaves club on loan
content: Paul Mullin, the poster boy of a Wrexham team soaring through England's football leagues following their takeover by Hollywood celebrities, has left the club to join League One side Wigan on a season-long loan deal.

title: Man arrested for death threats to Spain's Morata
content: A 19-year-old man has been arrested for making online death threats against Álvaro Morata and his family following the Spain captain's penalty miss against Portugal in the UEFA Nations League final.

title: Source: Forest in talks for Juve's Weah, Mbangula
content: Nottingham Forest are looking to Italy and have set their sights on Juventus players Timothy Weah and Samuel Mbangula to strengthen their squad this summer.

title: Chelsea's Jackson handed two-match ban after red
content: Chelsea's Nicolas Jackson has been handed a two-match ban following his red card against Flamengo at the Club World Cup, FIFA have confirmed.

title: Alex Telles: Botafogo not in U.S. just to 'see Mickey'
content: Botafogo have defied their critics by making it to the Club World Cup last 16, with Alex Telles saying the Brazilian club proved wrong those who said they came to the U.S. just to "see Mickey."

title: Mock draft: Derrick Henry biggest mover in change to non-PPR
content: In this 12-team, non-PPR setup, the Ravens' star back went nearly 10 picks earlier than he has in PPR mocks this summer.

title: Should you take Jeanty over Barkley in fantasy drafts?
content: Is the 2,000-yard RB being undervalued? Or is regression coming for him and the rookie is the better choice?

title: Whitcomb, Amihere lead top pickups this week
content: Sami Whitcomb and Laeticia Amihere are positioned to produce for their teams and fantasy managers ahead of a busy week in the WNBA.

title: How close is your team to an NBA title? We tiered all 30 franchises
content: While the world watched the Finals, the league's hierarchy shifted. Is OKC already looking over its shoulder ?

title: Redrafting the top 10 picks in every MLB draft from 2015 to 2024
content: Witt over Rutschman? Does Skenes still go No. 1? Let's go back in time to right the wrongs of the past 10 MLB drafts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: As Liverpool eye Alexander Isak, Newcastle try to keep him
content: Amid Liverpool interest, Newcastle are doing what they can to keep Alexander Isak from leaving. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Norman closing in on top spot at welterweight
content: Brian Norman Jr. earned his third consecutive KO win to retain the WBO welterweight title. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Jake Paul vs. Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.: How to find betting value for the fight
content: Taking Jake Paul to win doesn't offer much value, but there are other bets to consider for Saturday's bout.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: Not 'obliterated'? US intel says Iran can restore nuke sites 'within months'; contradicts Trump
content: Conflicting reports emerge regarding the success of US air strikes on Iran's nuclear program. While President Trump claimed complete obliteration, intelligence assessments suggest key facilities were damaged but not destroyed, potentially recoverable within months. Despite White House denials and a fragile ceasefire, experts warn Iran retains the capacity to reconstitute its nuclear program, raising concerns about long-term implications.

title: Chhattisgarh horror: Disabled killed, then encased in cement & put in suitcase; married couple held
content: A disabled man's body, found encased in cement within a suitcase and steel trunk in Raipur, led police to a married couple at Delhi airport. Lawyer Ankit Upadhyay and his wife are suspected of murdering Kishore Paikra over a land brokerage dispute.

title: For 2 decades, suicide among top 2 causes of death of young Indians
content: A recent analysis of cause of death reports reveals a concerning trend in India, where suicide remains a leading cause of death among young individuals aged 15-29. Between 2020 and 2022, suicides accounted for 17.1% of deaths in this age group, ranking second only to road accidents.

title: Pant creates a rare record no batter wants as India choke at Headingley
content: Rishabh Pant's exceptional batting prowess was on full display at Headingley, where he scored centuries in both innings, reaffirming his reputation as India's most fearless Test batter abroad. Despite his heroics and a crucial partnership with KL Rahul, India suffered a loss, highlighting the need for greater team support to convert Pant's individual brilliance into victories.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change this setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: 'Pushed into deep sea, but he’ll swim'- Gambhir on Gill’s first Test as captain
content: Gautam Gambhir has urged critics to give Shubman Gill time to prove himself as India's Test captain, despite a recent defeat against England. Gambhir praised Gill's leadership as "phenomenal," highlighting his first-innings century under pressure. He acknowledged the challenges of captaining in tough conditions and expressed confidence in Gill's potential for success.

title: Ostrava Golden Spike: Neeraj Chopra clinches top prize with 85.29m throw, only athlete to breach 85m-mark at event
content: Neeraj Chopra clinched the men's javelin title at the Ostrava Golden Spike meet in the Czech Republic with a throw of 85.29 metres. This victory follows his recent triumph at the Paris Diamond League. Douw Smit of South Africa secured second place, while Anderson Peters from Grenada finished third in the competition directed by Jan Zelezny.

title: 5 things world’s richest man Elon Musk said he will never own
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ box office collection day 5: Aamir Khan starrer maintains steady pace
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza's ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ has garnered significant audience attention, earning over Rs. 70 crore within five days of its release. Despite a dip on Monday, the film maintained its momentum on Tuesday, reaching a total collection of Rs. 75.15 crore. The movie, directed by R.S. Prasanna, is considered a spiritual sequel to ‘Taare Zameen Par’.

title: How Bill Gates reacted 'very differently' when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: Ceasefire imposed, ceasefire violated but 'war stopped'? : How Iran and Israel disappointed Trump- key developments
content: Donald Trump declared a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, but it quickly collapsed with both nations trading accusations and missile strikes. Trump expressed his frustration, particularly with Israel's actions. Israel retaliated to alleged Iranian violations, including a strike that killed a nuclear scientist, while Iran vowed a strong response to further aggression.

title: UK man arrested over Disneyland ‘wedding’ with 9-year-old Ukrainian girl
content: A British man, a convicted sex offender wanted in the UK, has been charged in France for staging a fake wedding at Disneyland Paris. He allegedly hired actors, including one to play the bride's father, for the ceremony where a nine-year-old Ukrainian girl was the 'bride'. The event, costing an estimated $150,000, was halted by Disneyland staff.

title: Kevin Durant has deeper reason why he won’t return to Warriors
content: Kevin Durant's move to the Houston Rockets is imminent, disappointing Golden State Warriors fans who hoped for his return. Durant's past issues with coach Steve Kerr's offensive strategies and lingering tensions from his time with Draymond Green contributed to his decision to avoid returning to Golden State. Durant is looking forward to a fresh start with the Rockets.

title: 'Friendly plane wave': Israel defies Trump's ceasefire plan; launches more missiles at Iran
content: Following a ceasefire agreement, tensions flared again between Israel and Iran, prompting US President Donald Trump to intervene. Trump assured that Israel would cease its attacks, claiming they would simply do a "Plane Wave" to Iran. Despite the ceasefire announcement, both sides accused each other of violations, with Israel citing Iranian missile fire.

title: 12 days of fire: Iran ends 'adventurism war' imposed by Israel; Tel Aviv shifts back focus to Gaza
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian declared the end of the 12-day war with Israel, attributing it to the nation's heroic resistance. In response, Israeli chief of staff Eyal Zamir announced a shift in focus back to dismantling Hamas in Gaza and securing the release of hostages. Israel is lifting restrictions on public gatherings, workplaces, and education, signaling a return to normalcy, though guidelines remain effective until Thursday evening.

title: Dwyane Wade’s daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit “What Jhumka?” while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: 'Not leaping to join BJP': Tharoor on his Op Sindoor article
content: Shashi Tharoor clarified that his praise for PM Modi's diplomatic efforts during Operation Sindoor doesn't signal a shift to the BJP. He emphasised national unity and India's interests as his motivations, highlighting the importance of cross-party solidarity in foreign policy. Tharoor's article sparked speculation amid Congress's criticism of the government's foreign policy.

title: 'She’s heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: IND vs ENG Test: Five hundreds, no win – India's century party ends in a hangover
content: England defeated India in a thrilling match at Headingley, taking a 1-0 lead in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Despite India's five individual centuries, England's strong batting performance, led by Jamie Smith and Joe Root, secured a record chase. India's inexperienced side couldn't capitalize on key moments, while England maintained composure to clinch victory.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Scoreline doesn't change that': Gambhir on Bumrah playing 'three Tests'
content: India's Test series under Shubman Gill started with a five-wicket defeat to England, raising concerns about managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload. Coach Gautam Gambhir confirmed Bumrah will play only three of the five Tests, regardless of the scoreline. England's historic win, chasing 371, highlighted India's batting collapses despite individual centuries.

title: 'Killed not because they knew physics but ... ': Israel kills 14 Iran scientists
content: Israel has openly acknowledged its military campaign targeting Iran's nuclear program, which involved the assassination of at least 14 senior Iranian nuclear scientists. According to Israeli officials, these individuals were directly involved in the creation and production of nuclear weapons.

title: Middle East conflict: Why Pakistan is the big loser
content: In a world defined by chaos, the US reminded everyone who still runs the show. Operation Midnight Hammer, led by Trump and executed with B-2 Spirit bombers, dismantled Iran’s nuclear infrastructure and revived American military swagger. Trump emerged as the ultimate winner, along with Netanyahu and the neocons. Meanwhile, the Axis of Resistance crumbled, Palestine was sidelined, and Pakistan embarrassed itself by nominating Trump for a Nobel before condemning him. China and Russia watched helplessly. As The Newsroom once noted, America leads in defence spending—and now, in reminding the world that it still decides when and how the show ends.

title: Operation Sindhu: 3,170 Indians evacuated from conflict-hit Israel, Iran
content: India successfully evacuated over 1,100 citizens from Iran and Israel. This evacuation was amidst rising tensions. Operation Sindhu brought back a total of 3,170 Indians. Evacuees from Israel were transported via Jordan and Egypt. Chartered flights from Amman and special flights from Mashhad facilitated the return. The conflict between Israel and Iran prompted this swift action by India.

title: 'We lose together, win together': Gambhir backs bowlers as Eng pull off record chase
content: England achieved a stunning five-wicket victory over India in the first Test at Headingley, chasing down a target of 371. Despite Rishabh Pant's twin centuries and India's mammoth score, batting collapses proved costly. Coach Gautam Gambhir emphasised the need to support the team and focus on collective improvement rather than blaming individuals, backing Shubman Gill's captaincy despite the loss.

title: A flight to nowhere! Qantas flight, airborne for 15 hours, returns to origin airport
content: A Qantas Airways flight from Perth to Paris was forced to return to its origin after 15 hours due to Iranian missile strikes causing widespread airspace closures in the Middle East. The diversion impacted other Qantas services, including the Perth-London route, which was rerouted to Singapore.

title: 'We had our chances': Gill rues drop catches as England draw first blood
content: Shubman Gill lamented India's missed opportunities after England's thrilling five-wicket victory in the first Test, highlighting dropped catches and lower-order batting failures. Ben Duckett's brilliant 149 and a crucial partnership between Joe Root and Jamie Smith guided England to overhaul the 371-run target. Gill acknowledged the need to rectify batting collapses and capitalize on chances in the upcoming matches.

title: Nightmare! Yashasvi creates 'unwanted record'; furious Gambhir reacts
content: In the first Test against England, Yashasvi Jaiswal had a tough time with dropped catches. KL Rahul scored a composed century. Rishabh Pant blasted a quickfire ton. Their partnership helped India set a target of 371. Pant also made history as the first Indian wicketkeeper to score two centuries in a Test away from home.

title: '1 minute mein 3 ball daal sakta hai kya?: Rishabh Pant trolls Mohammed Siraj - WATCH
content: During the India-England Test, Rishabh Pant's witty encouragement aimed to energize India's bowling attack before lunch. Despite Jasprit Bumrah's sharp performance and crucial dismissal of Duckett, other pacers struggled with consistency. England's openers, Duckett and Crawley, exploited loose deliveries, forming a strong partnership.

title: 'Mera hi umpire, mera hi game': Rishabh Pant's stump mic banter with Jadeja goes viral - WATCH
content: Rishabh Pant's lively chatter behind the stumps entertained fans during the first Test, but his on-field dissent earned him an ICC reprimand and a demerit point for breaching the Code of Conduct. The incident occurred when Pant disagreed with the umpires' decision not to replace the ball.

title: Israel says 'refrained' from further strikes after Trump-Netaynahu call
content: Following a phone call with US President Donald Trump, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office announced a halt to further strikes on Iran, after 12 days of conflict. This decision came after Israel accused Iran of violating the ceasefire brokered by Trump, even vowing a forceful response. Trump expressed displeasure with Israel's immediate actions after the ceasefire agreement.

title: 4th-floor suicide bid foiled in seconds: Chennai woman dragged back from window ledge
content: Sub-Inspector Meera of the Mambalam Police Station was lauded for her quick thinking and bravery after rescuing a 27-year-old woman from a suicide attempt in T. Nagar. Dovina, distressed over a failed relationship, threatened to jump from her apartment window.

title: Tony Gonzalez ex Lauren Sanchez engaged — set to wed Jeff Bezos in Venice — NFL legend left behind
content: Lauren Sanchez, former girlfriend of Tony Gonzalez and mother to his son Nikko, is set to marry Jeff Bezos in a lavish Venetian wedding. The event, estimated at $50,000 per guest, will host 200 A-listers. Despite some online confusion, Gonzalez's wife, October, remains close to Sanchez and even attended her bachelorette party.

title: "It Was My Great Honour To Destroy All Iranian Nuclear Facilities.": Trump
content: Trump on Tuesday expressed his satisfaction in stopping "THE WAR" between Iran and Israel, asserting that it was his "great honour" to destroy all of Iran's nuclear facilities and capabilities before brokering a ceasefire between the two nations.

title: Hearing In Sheikh Hasina's Crimes Against Humanity Case On July 1
content: The indictment hearing in the crimes against humanity case against Bangladesh's deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been set for July 1, the country's crimes tribunal announced on Tuesday.

title: US Strikes On Iran Did Not Destroy Nuclear Sites: Report
content: An early US intelligence assessment indicated that the US military strikes on three of Iran's nuclear facilities last week did not destroy the core components of Tehran's nuclear program and likely only set it back by months, CNN reported on Tuesday.

title: Operation Sindhu: 282 More Indians Evacuated From Iran; Total Reaches 2,858
content: Another special flight carrying 282 Indian nationals stranded in conflict-hit Iran landed safely in New Delhi on Wednesday, taking the total number of people evacuated under Operation Sindhu to 2,858.

title: Trump Tells Congress Iran Had Nuclear Weapons Program, Contradicting US Spy Agencies
content: U.S. President Donald Trump told Congress this week that the Iranian sites bombed by the U.S. housed a "nuclear weapons development program," even though U.S. spy agencies have said no such program existed.

title: Earthquake Of 4.2 Magnitude Hits Andaman Sea
content: An earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Richter scale struck the Andaman Sea in the early hours on Wednesday, according to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS).

title: Netanyahu Vows To Thwart "Any Attempt" By Iran To Rebuild Nuclear Programme
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared a "historic victory" on Tuesday after agreeing a ceasefire with Iran and insisted that his country's arch-foe would never achieve a nuclear weapon.

title: Netanyahu Hails Historic Win, Commits To Campaign Against Iran Axis, Hamas
content: PM Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that Israel had achieved a historic victory that would stand for generations, but it must complete its campaign against Iran's axis, defeat Hamas and bring about the return of all the hostages in Gaza.

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi, Raj Kushwaha Admitted To Relationship: Cops On Honeymoon Murder
content: Sonam Rahuvanshi and her boyfriend Raj Kushwaha, who had allegedly conspired and killed her husband Raja Raghuvanshi, have admitted to their relationship, the Meghalaya police have said.

title: Crime, Terror, Rape: United States Flags India Travel Risks
content: Officials in the Trump administration have also recommended that women avoid traveling alone and stay alert, especially at tourist destinations and public spaces.

title: Cops Garland Thief With Shoes And Parade Him In Jammu, Probe Ordered
content: A police team in Jammu and Kashmir have waded into controversy after they were caught on camera garlanding a thief with shoes and slippers and parading him around Jammu.

title: Elections To Chandigarh Mayoral Polls Can Now Be Held By Show Of Hands
content: Election to the posts of mayor, senior deputy mayor, and deputy mayor of the Chandigarh Municipal Corporation can now be held by a show of hands instead of a secret ballot.

title: Grenade Explodes At Security Forces Camp In Assam, 3 Cops Injured
content: A grenade exploded in a security forces camp in Assam's Golaghat district on Tuesday night, leaving three police personnel injured.

title: In A Surprise Announcement, Trump Asks China To 'Keep Buying Oil From Iran'
content: In a sudden twist in Washington's Iran policy, US President Donald Trump made an unexpected announcement shortly after declaring a ceasefire between Iran and Israel after nearly two weeks of air strikes and missile attacks.

title: Jagan Reddy's Bulletproof Car, Involved In Accident In Which Supporter Died, Seized
content: The Andhra Pradesh police on Tuesday seized YSRCP chief Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy's bulletproof vehicle, which was allegedly involved in an accident during his recent tour of Rentapalla village in Palnadu district.

title: Russia Welcomes Iran-Israel Ceasefire, Hopes It Will Last
content: Russia said on Tuesday that it would welcome a ceasefire between Iran and Israel, after both sides and US President Donald Trump announced a halt in hostilities.

title: Delhi Woman Allegedly Pushed Off From Rooftop, Dies; Accused Arrested
content: A 19-year-old woman, who was allegedly pushed off the rooftop of her house in northeast Delhi's Ashok Nagar area by a person known to her, has succumbed to her injuries during treatment, an official said on Tuesday.

title: 2.5 Million Refugees Face Uncertainty As Global Resettlement Access Shrinks
content: An estimated 2.5 million refugees worldwide will need to be resettled next year, the UN said Tuesday, at a time when the United States but also other nations are shrinking resettlement access.

title: UN Rights Chief Urges Sri Lanka To Ensure Accountability For Wartime Atrocities
content: The United Nations human rights chief urged Sri Lanka on Tuesday to ensure accountability for crimes committed during its protracted ethnic war.

title: UK Government Says Chinese Spying On The Rise, Pledges $818 Million To Intelligence
content: Chinese spying and attempts by Beijing to undermine Britain's democracy and economy have risen in recent years, the UK government said Tuesday in a report on the Asian giant.
